required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intravenous Infusion of Lidocaine in Colonoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Intravenous Infusion of Lidocaine in Sedation for Colonoscopy: a Randomised Placebo-controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: intravenous infusion of lidocaine significantly reduce fatigue and pain and improve the patients satisfaction after sedation for colonoscopy.

detailed_description.textblock: This study divide patients into two groups, lidocaine group one will be given lidocaine intravenously; control group will be given saline . the difference between patients fatigue and pain will be compared. and the propofol consumption, pain after infusion of propofol, patients, endoscopists and anaesthesist satifaction, the incidence of hypotenstion, hypoxia, and bradycardia will aslo be compared between the two groups.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are randomly assigned to controll group or lidocaine group. Participants of control group are given placebo while participants of lidocaine group are given lidocaine.

primary_outcome.description: fatigue were measured on a 0-10VAS at arrival in the recovery room ,30min later

secondary_outcome.description: pain were measured on a 0-10VAS at arrival in the recovery room ,30min later

other_outcome.description: infusion pain was divided into no pain, mide pain and severe pain

other_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by the rate of hypoxia during the procedure Safety assessed by the rate of hypoxia during the procedure
other_outcome.description: Hypoxia, defined as peripheral oxygen saturation <90% for >10 seconds

other_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by the rate of hypotention during the procedure
other_outcome.description: Hypotension, defined as systolic blood pressure <90 mmHg

other_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by the rate of breadycardia during the procedure
other_outcome.description: Bradycardia, defined as heart rate <50 beats/min

other_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by the rate of required airway management during the procedure
other_outcome.description: Required airway management such as jaw lifting, mask ventilation, or tracheal intubation in severe hypoxia Required airway management such as jaw lifting, mask ventilation, or tracheal intubation in severe hypoxia

other_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by the rate of involuntary movement
other_outcome.description: Involuntary movements, defined as unconscious movements requiring restraint or severe limb movement

other_outcome.measure: endoscopists satisfaction assessed by the performer
other_outcome.description: the endoscopists satisfacition score were assessed on a 0-10VAS after the procedure

other_outcome.measure: patient satisfaction assessed by the patient
other_outcome.description: the patient satisfacition score were assessed on a 0-10VAS 30mins after the procedure

other_outcome.measure: anesthetist satisfaction assessed by the anesthestist
other_outcome.description: the anesthetist satisfacition score were assessed on a 0-10VAS after the procedure

arm_group.description: the control group will be given the same volume of saline as the experimental group
the experimental group will be given l-1.5mg lidocaine and then 2mg/kg/h

intervention.description: the control group will be given the same volume of saline.
the experimental group will be given 1-1.5mg/kg lidocaine and then 2mg/kg/h

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Inclusion Criteria: patients aged >18 years who were scheduled for colonscopy at Qilu hospital.
Exclusion Criteria:patients with ASA (American Society of Anesthesiologists) Class 4 or 5, pre-existing hypoxemia (SpO2 <90%), hypotension (systolic blood pressure <90 mm Hg), bradycardia (HR<50 beats/min), uncontrolled hypertension (SBP >170 mm Hg, diastolic blood pressure>100 mm Hg), severe renal or liver failure, pregnancy or lactation, allergy to lidocaine, atrioventricular block, epilepsy, and inability to give informed consen
-

facility.name: Department of Gastroenterology, Qilu Hospital, Shandong University
